Package com.fssa.projectprovision.dao

Class UserDAO

java.lang.Object
com.fssa.projectprovision.dao.UserDAO
public class UserDAO extends Object
The UserDAO class provides methods for accessing and manipulating user data in the database. This class is responsible for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting user records. Usage: UserDAO userDAO = new UserDAO(); boolean userCreated = userDAO.createUser(newUser); User retrievedUser = userDAO.getUserByEmail(email); // Use the methods to interact with the database and manipulate User records
Author:
JayaprakashJaisankar

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      public static boolean createUser(User user) throws DAOException
      Creates a new user in the database with the provided user data.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object containing the user's information to be created.
      Returns:
      True if the user creation was successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an issue with the database operation.

    • getUserByEmail

      public static User getUserByEmail(String email) throws DAOException
      Retrieves a user's data from the database based on the provided email.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address associated with the user to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The User object containing the user's information, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an issue with the database operation.

    • getAllUsers

      public static List<User> getAllUsers() throws DAOException
      Retrieves a list of all users' data from the database.
      Returns:
      A List containing User objects with information about all users.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an issue with the database operation.

    • updateUser

      public static boolean updateUser(User user) throws DAOException
      Updates a user's data in the database with the provided user information.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object containing the updated user's information.
      Returns:
      True if the user update was successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an issue with the database operation.

    • deleteUserByEmail

      public static boolean deleteUserByEmail(String email) throws DAOException
      Deletes a user from the database based on the provided email.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address associated with the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True if the user deletion was successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an issue with the database operation.
